result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Blankenheim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 90 days or penalty of 30 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

Costs to be paid in 90 days or penalty of 4 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

As of 09/01/2016:   Refund check was issued to deft./poster. Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.

With Huber. Release for standard conditions.  May be served in Ozaukee County.
Consecutive to: Ozaukee County Case

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

re: DNA surcharge refund letter signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert C Blankenheim in court, in custody (appears in street clothes but is in custody(huber) at Ozaukee County), with Attorney Paul E Bucher.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bucher requests that handcuffs be removed on Defendant for hearing today.  Court denies request. Case called for plea and sentence hearing.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bucher makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE:     *Consecutive to Ozaukee County case*

15 DAYS HUBER,  Huber with standard release conditions.   *Transfer allowed to Ozaukee County*    
 
RESTITUTION:  $0    (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

FINE:  $1,513.00 &  $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid within 90 days, alternate 34 days jail, consecutive, if not paid)
Order allowing defendant to wear street clothes for 11/05/14 hearing. Signed by Judge Carter on 11/03/14.
(Fax) Dated 10/29/14, from Atty Bucher to Judge Carter, requesting allow the defendant to appear at the 11/05/14 plea/sentencing hearing in street clothes.
(Fax) Dated 10/28/14, from Atty Bucher to Judge Carter, with information for 11/05/14 sentencing.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Ozaukee County Jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert C Blankenheim in court with Attorney Paul E. Bucher.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bucher requests an adjournment so Defendant can pay restitution and accept state's offer.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
